gov.usgs.anss.edge

Class EdgeBlockQueue

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edge.EdgeBlockQueue

  • public class EdgeBlockQueue
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a ring buffer of the data blocks as they are written into disk blocks. It is entirely static as their can only be one such queue global to all channels of data within an edge node (or at least a single EdgeMom). The methods are synchronized to insure consistent access. The data are tracked by their sequence number which varies from 1 to MAX_SEQUENCE. (zero has been reserved to indicate unknown sequence). The data are physically stored in sequence % maxqueue which is stipulated at construction (maxqueue must divide evenly into MAX_SEQUENCE).

      • MAX_SEQUENCE

        public static int MAX_SEQUENCE
        this is the max sequence. They go from 1 to this value

    • Constructor Detail

      • EdgeBlockQueue

        public EdgeBlockQueue(int maxq)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Creates a new instance of EdgeBlockServer. The given maxq must divide evenly into the MAX_SEQUENCE (2,000,000,000 at this time) or it is an error
        Parameters:
        maxq - The size of the queue to create (this times BUFFER_LENGTH is memory consumed
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if MAX_SEQUENCE % maxq != 0

      • queue

        public static int queue(int julian,
                        java.lang.String node,
                        java.lang.StringBuilder seedName,
                        int nblk,
                        int indexBlock,
                        int index,
                        byte[] buf,
                        int offset)
        queue in data given the component julian day, block number and 512 mini-seed bytes
        Parameters:
        julian - The julian day
        node - The node of the edge computer (this + julian gives the filename!).
        nblk - Physical block number in file
        seedName - The seedname of the block
        indexBlock - The indexBlock number of the index block associated with this block
        index - The index into the index block for the extent so modified.
        buf - 512 bytes of Mini-seed data
        offset - Offset in buf at which to start transfer
        Returns:
        The sequence number assigned this block

      • nleft

        Parameters:
        i - The sequence number the inquirer is at
        Returns:
        The number of blocks left in the queue

      • getEdgeBlock

        public static EdgeBlock getEdgeBlock(int i)
        get the EdgeBlock with the given sequence, this is an object in the ring buffer so it must be used before it is over written by what ever is filling the ring buffer. If this is not save use the other getEdgeBlock which copies the data out.
        Parameters:
        i - the sequence of the desired block
        Returns:
        The EdgeBlock at this sequence, null if not available

      • getEdgeBlock

        public static boolean getEdgeBlock(EdgeBlock eb,
                                   int i)
        get the EdgeBlock with the given sequence, return is to user allocated buffer in an edgeblock (it is copied into the user objection
        Parameters:
        eb - The user object to copy the block into (note it needs to be created or the copy fails)
        i - the sequence of the desired block
        Returns:
        The EdgeBlock at this sequence, null if not available

      • isContinuation

        public static boolean isContinuation(int i)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        return whether the block is a continuation block (julian < 0)
        Parameters:
        i - The index in the queue of the block to check
        Returns:
        true if Julian is < 0 indicating a continuation
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the value of i is not within the queue range

      • getData

        public static void getData(int i,
                           byte[] buf,
                           int offset)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        return the mini-seed payload of the block of sequence given. This is returned in the users buffer and is a copy of the data block not subject to change by this thread
        Parameters:
        i - The sequence desired
        buf - Buffer of 512 bytes (at least) to get the data
        offset - The offset in the byte buffer to place the data.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the sequence is not in the ring buffer.
